definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself

sentences.english: Violent crime is only one of the malady afflict modern society.
sentences.chinese: “獨斷論”是當今學術研究的弊病。

sentences.english: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way, and shall be filled with their own devices.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們必要自食其果，飽嘗獨斷獨行的滋味。

sentences.english: In the meanwhile, they also point out and criticize Qianlong's arbitrary decisions and peremptory actions.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，他們也指斥了乾隆的專橫獨斷等行爲。

sentences.english: They dare not break the herd, afraid of the ridicule of their neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他們怕鄰居譏笑，不敢獨斷獨行。

sentences.english: Nevertheless you are in a self-assertive mood today.
sentences.chinese: 今天你的情緒會比較獨斷獨行。

sentences.english: Mingjun arbitrary, it is also the right not to Robinson.
sentences.chinese: 明君獨斷，故權不在臣也。

sentences.english: Kant criticized the metaphysical dogmatism both in synchronic and diachronic way.
sentences.chinese: 康德從歷時和共時兩方面理性批判了形而上學獨斷論。

sentences.english: A corollary is that arbitrary administrative power would have to be severely limited.
sentences.chinese: 一個必然的結果是獨斷的行政權力將會被極大的限制。
人與人之間病在獨行獨斷。

sentences.english: Dogmatism is a malady in the academic research nowadays .
sentences.chinese: “獨斷論”是當今學術研究的弊病。

sentences.english: South autocratic, gas go west light.
sentences.chinese: 向南獨斷專行，氣走西光。

sentences.english: The autocratic Chinese leadership gets things done fast (currently the autocrats seem to be highly effective).
sentences.chinese: 目前看來，獨斷專行似乎非常有效。

sentences.english: The new dialectical epistemology has replaced the dogmatism of traditional philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 以辯證的認識論的新方法取消了傳統哲學的獨斷論。

sentences.english: You're a natural leader but often like to do things by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你是一位天生的領導者，卻喜歡獨斷獨行。

sentences.english: It is wrong to indulge in arbitrary decisions and peremptory actions and to ignore our allies.
sentences.chinese: 那種獨斷專行，把同盟者置之不理的態度，是不對的。

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)
art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
